text: <@U01QVR44MEY> I ended up following the workflow lined out in <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRGX60V2wQ2Co9X1NO73hkLObcQdNWp2i49XE-pY_DRS6UjZnv4UuODz4nsI_g1gUIXFC1MhN4AFsnZ/pub|this serverless package.json beta doc> and its been fantastic
you probably already know this but without that beta I’d have to handle my own express set-up… but it did it all for me and for that I am thankful

The one thing I didn't know about the beta (and I found a couple days ago) was that pushing the publish button doesn't do anything (to my knowledge) and that you have to then right click the function and deploy all
watch out for that in the event you are lazy and don't decide to go the cli route for old functions

I am having trouble implementing the required package.json file in my serverless function as per the HubSpot changelogs:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/deprecation-of-node-v12-in-all-serverless-functions>

The change log does not state if the package.json should live at the root folder level for the function or the .functions folder.

I tried following this git example but the git example puts the package.json file in the .functions folder which I am not able to do because I get an error in the terminal stating that only .js and serverless.json files can be used within the .functions folder:
<https://github.com/HubSpot/serverless-function-examples/tree/master/cms/custom-build/custom-build.functions>

I also looked at the HubSpot docs to see where the pagcakge.json file for a serverless function should live and the necessary structure for said file, it is not listed/ there is no example of this in the docs, (although the version of node was updated):
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-serverless-functions>

Can some one from HubSpot please advise me on how to get my serverless function compliant with the changelog? I’ve updated node as needed now I need help with adding the package.json file for a serverless function.
